keywordspec.name: HttpLibrary.HTTP
keywordspec.doc:
HttpLibrary for Robot Framework
*JSON*
The JSON related keywords use JSON Pointer. To learn more about JSON Pointer, go to http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pbryan-zyp-json-pointer-00.

kw.name: Create Http Context
kw.doc:
Sets the HTTP host to use for future requests. You must call this before issuing any HTTP requests.
`host` is the name of the host, optionally with port (e.g. 'google.com' or 'localhost:5984') `scheme` the protocol scheme to use. Valid values are 'http', 'https'

kw.name: DELETE
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP DELETE request.
`url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: Follow Response
kw.doc: Follows a HTTP redirect if the previous response status code was a 301 or 302.

kw.name: GET
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP GET request.
`url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: Get Json Value
kw.doc:
Get the target node of the JSON document `json_string` specified by `json_pointer`.
Example: | ${result}= | Get Json Value | {"foo": {"bar": [1,2,3]}} | /foo/bar | | Should Be Equal | ${result} | [1, 2, 3] | |

kw.name: Get Response Body
kw.doc:
Get the response body.
Example: | GET | /foo.xml | | | ${body}= | Get Response Body | | | Should Start With | ${body} | <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" |

kw.name: Get Response Header
kw.doc:
Get the response header with the name `header_name`
If there are two headers with the same key, the return value of this keyword is a list containing both values.

kw.name: Get Response Status
kw.doc:
Returns the response status line (e.g. "200 OK" or "404 Not found")
Notice, this is not the response status code (e.g. 200), but the entire first line of the response. To check for a status code, use the following:
Example: | ${status}= | Get Response Status | | | Should Start With | 200 | ${status} |

kw.name: HEAD
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP HEAD request.
`url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: Http Request
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP request with an uncommon HTTP Verb.
`verb` is the HTTP Verb to use, e.g. "PROPFIND", "PATCH", "OPTIONS" `url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: Json Value Should Equal
kw.doc:
Fails if the value of the target node of the JSON document `json_string` specified by JSON Pointer `json_pointer` is not `expected_value`.
Example: | Set Test Variable | ${doc} | {"foo": {"bar": [1,2,3]}} | | | Json Value Should Equal | ${doc} | /foo/bar | "[1, 2, 3]" |

kw.name: Json Value Should Not Equal
kw.doc:
Fails if the value of the target node of the JSON document `json_string` specified by JSON Pointer `json_pointer` is `expected_value`.
Example: | Set Test Variable | ${doc} | {"foo": {"bar": [1,2,3]}} | | | Json Value Should Not Equal | ${doc} | /foo/bar | "[1, 2, 3]" |

kw.name: Log Json
kw.doc: Logs a pretty printed version of the JSON document `json_string`.

kw.name: Log Response Body
kw.doc:
Logs the response body.
Specify `log_level` (default: "INFO") to set the log level.

kw.name: Log Response Headers
kw.doc:
Logs the response headers, line by line.
Specify `log_level` (default: "INFO") to set the log level.

kw.name: Log Response Status
kw.doc:
Logs the response status line
Specify `log_level` (default: "INFO") to set the log level.

kw.name: Next Request May Not Succeed
kw.doc: Don't fail the next request if it's status code is >= 400

kw.name: Next Request Should Have Status Code
kw.doc: Fails the next request if it's status code is different from `status_code`.

kw.name: Next Request Should Not Succeed
kw.doc: Fails the next request if it's status code is < 400

kw.name: Next Request Should Succeed
kw.doc: Fails the next request if it's status code is >= 400. This is the standard behaviour (only use this keyword if you specified `Next Request Should Not Succeed` earlier.

kw.name: Parse Json
kw.doc:
Parses the JSON document `json_string` and returns a data structure.
Example: | ${result}= | Parse Json | [1, 2, 3] | | Length Should Be | ${result} | 3 |
`json_string` is the string containg JSON that will be parsed

kw.name: POST
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP POST request.
`url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: PUT
kw.doc:
Issues a HTTP PUT request.
`url` is the URL relative to the server root, e.g. '/_utils/config.html'

kw.name: Response Body Should Contain
kw.doc:
Fails if the response body does not contain `should_contain`
Example: | GET | /foo.xml | | Response Body Should Contain | version="1.0" | | Response Body Should Contain | encoding="UTF-8" |

kw.name: Response Header Should Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the value of response header `header_name` does not equal `expected`. Also fails if the last response does not have a `header_name` header.

kw.name: Response Header Should Not Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the value of response header `header_name` equals `expected` Also fails if the last response does not have a `header_name` header.

kw.name: Response Should Have Header
kw.doc: Fails if the response does not have a header named `header_name`

kw.name: Response Should Not Have Header
kw.doc: Fails if the response does has a header named `header_name`

kw.name: Response Status Code Should Equal
kw.doc:
Fails if the response status code of the previous request was not the specified one.
`status_code` the status code to compare against.

kw.name: Response Status Code Should Not Equal
kw.doc:
Fails if the response status code of the previous request is equal to the one specified.
`status_code` the status code to compare against.

kw.name: Restore Http Context
kw.doc: Restores HttpLibrary's state to the point before the last "Create Http Context" call.

kw.name: Set Basic Auth
kw.doc:
Set HTTP Basic Auth for next request.
See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication
`username` is the username to authenticate with, e.g. 'Aladdin'
`password` is the password to use, e.g. 'open sesame'

kw.name: Set Http Host
kw.doc: *DEPRECATED* Use `Create HTTP Context` instead.

kw.name: Set Json Value
kw.doc:
Set the target node of the JSON document `json_string` specified by JSON Pointer `json_pointer` to `json_value`.
Example: | ${result}= | Set Json Value | {"foo": {"bar": [1,2,3]}} | /foo | 12 | | Should Be Equal | ${result} | {"foo": 12} | | |

kw.name: Set Request Body
kw.doc:
Set the request body for the next HTTP request.
Example: | Set Request Body | user=Aladdin&password=open%20sesame | | POST | /login | | Response Should Succeed | |

kw.name: Set Request Header
kw.doc:
Sets a request header for the next request.
`header_name` is the name of the header, e.g. `User-Agent` `header_value` is the key of the header, e.g. `RobotFramework HttpLibrary (Mozilla/4.0)`

kw.name: Should Be Valid Json
kw.doc:
Attempts to parse `json_string` as JSON. Fails, if `json_string` is invalid JSON.
Example: | Should Be Valid Json | {"foo": "bar"} |

kw.name: Show Response Body In Browser
kw.doc:
Opens your default web browser with the last request's response body.
This is meant for debugging response body's with complex media types.

kw.name: Stringify Json
kw.doc:
Converts the data structure to a string containing its JSON string representation
Example: | ${data} = | Create List | 1 2 3 | | ${json_string}= | Stringify JSON | ${data} | | Should Be Equal As Strings | ${json_string} | ["1", "2", "3"] |
`data` is the data structure to convert to json
